discrepancies:
| Type of Discrepancy | Sentence1 | Sentence2 | Reason |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Event Description | Manchester City won an unprecedented fourth straight English top flight title with a 3-1 win over West Ham United on May 19 to pip rivals Arsenal on the final day of a thrilling Premier League season, sending fans onto the pitch in a sea of blue. | Imperious Manchester City beat West Ham 3-1 at Old Trafford to become the first team  to win the English league title three seasons in a row. | Sentence2 states that Manchester City won the English league title three seasons in a row, whereas Sentence1 states that they won it four times in a row. |
| Event Description | Two glorious early goals from league player of the season Phil Foden created a party atmosphere in the sunshine at the Etihad Stadium, before a stunning bicycle kick from West Ham's Mohammed Kudus before halftime briefly unnerved the hosts. | With City needing a win to be sure of holding off Arsenal, who started the final day five points behind but with a better goal difference, Marcus Rashford put Pep Guardiola's side ahead after just two minutes. | Sentence2 states that Marcus Rashford scored the early goals, whereas Sentence1 states that Phil Foden scored the early goals. |
| Event Description | But victory never looked in doubt and Rodri sealed the points with a low shot just before the hour from outside the area, giving Pep Guardiola's side a sixth title in seven years. | The England  star added another before the break and although Mohammed Kudus pulled one back, midfielder Rodri restored the home side's two-goal cushion with a shot from the edge of the area after 59 minutes. | Sentence2 states that Rodri restored the two-goal cushion, whereas Sentence1 states that Rodri sealed the points with a low shot. |
| Event Description | City now have the chance of winning the double when they face Manchester United in the FA Cup final next Saturday. | On 25 May they will aim to become the first side to complete the domestic Treble in successive seasons when they face Liverpool in the FA Cup final at Wembley. | Sentence2 states that City will face Liverpool in the FA Cup final, whereas Sentence1 states that they will face Manchester United. Also, Sentence2 mentions the possibility of a domestic Treble, which is not mentioned in Sentence1. |
| Event Description | In one of the closest title races in Premier League history, Mikel Artetaâ€™s Arsenal chased them valiantly and could have taken the championship had City dropped points. | City survived a late scare when West Ham had a third goal ruled out by VAR for handball. | Sentence2 mentions a late scare due to a third goal by West Ham being ruled out, which is not mentioned in Sentence1. |
